title: Product Property of nth Roots
text: $$\sqrt[n]{a b}$$ is equal to $$\sqrt[n]{a} \sqrt[n]{b}$$ as long as a and b are integers $$ \geq $$ 2 and their roots are real numbers

title: How to Use the Product Property
text: Since 3 is odd, remember that $$\sqrt[3]{x^3}$$ is just x. Is there a way to split the root in the problem into two such that one of the new roots is in the form $$\sqrt[3]{x^3}$$?
